result.execSummary:
The defendant John Paul Cardenas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

9:31 AM Defendant John Paul Cardenas in court.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch in court for John Paul Cardenas.  Attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2, Court finds defendant guilty, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1 dismissed, read in, Court sentences defendant to, Ct. 2: 5 days jail, 5 days sentence credit, sentence is TIME SERVED, $543.00 costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample, warrant quashed, 9:40 A.M.

3:03 PM Defendant John Paul Cardenas not in court.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch in court for John Paul Cardenas.  Attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hatch updated the court as regards to defendant's whereabouts. State has no position, court authorized warrant but stayed until 10/17/2022 at 10:00 AM 3:05 PM

Atty Hatch advised the court that defendant had gone mistakenly to Wood County Courthouse.  State does not have a position.  Atty Hatch to reschedule plea and sentencing with Judicial assistant.  Warrant withheld at this time.  Adjourned at 11:00 AM.
